title: Hong Kong protests: Violence 'organized', Occupy Central leaders say â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: occupy : 'we wo n't easily call off the movement '

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : violence visited the hong kong protests for the first time in a week as counter-protesters confronted and in some cases attacked students and others .
an unknown number were injured .
most of the clashes took place in mong kok , kowloon , where police said they arrested 19 people .
occupy central leaders said the attacks on protesters were organized .
police said some of those arrested had ties to organized crime .
while protesters said police had not done enough to stop attacks on protesters , in some cases the police seemed simply to be outnumbered .
i was very struck by how low the police numbers were , the guardian 's tania branigan said .
read tania 's latest news report from the scene here .
listen to her audio report here .
there were reports of sexual assault and harassment at the mong kok protest and of attacks on journalists .
none of the violence was tied to the students ' side .
the basic lines of the conflict appeared unchanged .
thousands of protesters remained in the streets .
the government made no sign of political concessions .
student leaders said they would not participate in a dialogue proposed by the government thursday until attacks on protesters stopped .
the hong kong government issued what it called another stern warning to protesters to leave the streets .
an editorial in the state people 's daily praised the hong kong police for always abiding by the principle of rule of law .
read the previous blog summary here .
the protest rises again in mong kok : benjamin ( @ garvey b ) hk protesters in mong kok put their tarpaulins back up
some of the 19 people arrested in mong kok friday have links to organized crime , hong kong police say : scmp news ( @ scmp news ) 19 men arrested in mong kok clashes .
police confirm some have triad background :
the violence is n't coming from the students ' side , reporters agree : carrie gracie ( @ bbccarrie ) likewise .
rt @ twitterid : to be absolutely clear , have seen no violence/provocation/retaliation from students .
plenty from other side .
i spoke with tania branigan about 90 minutes ago about what happened in mong kok and the scene overnight in admiralty .

tania said there 's been quite a lot of angry feeling in mong kok against the protests : there 's no doubt that people up there in many cases are annoyed by the inconvenience , they 're angered , they feel their businesses are suffering .
so there certainly was anti-protest feeling there .

but having said that , the way in which people moved in the fact that some of the men were masked , that there seemed to be organized attempts to clear out tents and so forth really raised sus that there was something more here , and so certainly some of the occupy central leaders have said they fear that 's possibly triad involvement , gang involvement .
now what motivates that , we do n't know .

there 's certainly a feeling among protesters that police here did not do enough to help them , tania says : although the officers on the ground in many cases were really sort of trying to hold back these people who were trying to get at the students , and in several cases were removing people from the crowd , and dragging them out of the area i was very struck by how low the police numbers were , and just how long it took to bring in reinforcements , and i think for the police on the ground , that was a very very difficult situation .
tania says it 's unclear how many people were hurt .
she says there are reports of threats against women specifically .

many protesters remained in admiralty , where the scene was much more calm , tania reported : there 's a really striking number of people here there are still clearly thousands of people here , even at 3 o'clock in the morning .
and some people have said , well , we heard about what 's been happening , and wanted to come down . '
so i think there is that sense that perhaps the violence has actually encouraged people to come back out in support .
( editing thanks @ twitterid )
a man breaks through police lines and attempts to reach the pro-democracy tent on october 3 , 2014 in mong kok , hong kong .

leung 's office on october 4 , 2014 in hong kong , hong kong .
campean/getty images

the chief executive 's office in central was the main scene of action thursday , when students said they would take over buildings if cy leung did not step down and police appeared in force to protect the offices .
tonight it appears to be quiet there : laurel chor ( @ laurelchor ) only a handful of people in front of ce office .
# occupyhk
pepper spray out in mong kok : leo weese ç® èå° ( @ leoaw ) police are threatening pepper spray as they further try to release their colleagues .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : a tense scene continued to play out in mong kok , the site of violent clashes earlier friday between occupy protesters and counter-protesters .
while counter-protesters appeared to have left mong kok , the police presence was building , and protesters yelled at police , accusing them of collusion with triads , the organized crime group .
amnesty international said police inaction tonight is shameful and said women and girls had been targeted in incidents of sexual assault and harrassment .
throughout the day , police appeared to be outnumbered in mong kok and elsewhere .
in admiralty the protest scene maintained its accustomed late-night , crowded calm .
youth leaders called off a proposed dialogue with the government , accusing police of a failure to protect protesters .
occupy leader chan kin-man said the movement supported the students ' rejection of dialogue .
we wo n't easily call off the movement , he said .
we have to be very careful .
chan said attacks on protesters were very concerted , and that 's why students believe that it might have some political motivation behind .
the hong kong government issued what it called another stern warning to protesters to leave the streets .
read the previous blog summary .
it appears the street remains active in mong kok : adrian o'sullivan ( @ adrianmichaelo ) mong kok in high spirit despite rumors of gas to come .
police diminished , pro beijing gone , peace restored # occupyhk isabella steger ( @ stegersaurus ) 2 cop cars pull up on reclamation street w shields and helmets

documents.title: amnesty : 'police inaction is shameful '
text: hong kong police failed to protect protesters and women and girls were targeted in incidents of sexual harassment and assault , amnesty international said friday in a statement .

hong kong 's police failed in their duty to protect hundreds of peaceful pro-democracy protesters from attacks by counter demonstrators on friday evening , the statement begins : women and girls were among those targeted , including incidents of sexual assault , harassment and intimidation , as counter-demonstrators clashed with pro-democracy protesters in the mongkok and causeway bay areas of hong kong on friday evening .
mabel au , director of amnesty international hong kong , said : the police inaction tonight is shameful .
the authorities have failed in their duty to protect peaceful protesters who came under attack .
there has been a heavy police presence during the past week , but their failure tonight risks fuelling an increasingly volatile situation .
here 's more of occupy central leader chan kin-man speaking early saturday in admiralty .
asked about who was responsible for attacks on protesters in mong kok , chan said it is a very organized attack : these people did n't look like just some ordinary residents in that area .
in some attacks , you know , these people all wear masks , and do things in a very concerted effort .
so you can tell that it is a very organized attack .
and that 's why students believe that it might have some political motivation behind .
and so that 's why they have to stop the arrangement of the dialogue at this moment .
and we have to review the situation .
we will start the dialogue only after we review the situation .
and we will respect the students ' decision in this .

documents.title: occupy : 'we wo n't easily call off the movement '
text: we wo n't easily call off the movement , occupy central leader chan kin-man tells the guardian 's tania branigan : today , when we found that protesters ' lives are being threatened we might call off the protest in certain sites .
whether the whole movement will be called off before we have any answer , response from the government , we will be careful to concede in this matter .
we wo n't easily call off the movement .
we have to be very careful .
we are still in the process of discussion .

more than 24 hours after an offer by the government to hold talks with protesters an offer made without an accompanying signal of openness to concessions the two sides appear more entrenched than ever : tania branigan ( @ taniabranigan ) chan kin-man of occupy central : `` we will not easily call off the movement '' - need answers from the govt

police in mong kok have asked protesters to shrink the demonstration area : isabella steger ( @ stegersaurus ) `` if u want to continue occupying here we ask u to shrink the area , for public safety and order . ''

the latest report by tania branigan ( @ taniabranigan ) from hong kong summarizes what happened today in mong kok and reports on accusations by occupy leaders that triads , the organized crime group , played a role in the violence .

thugs punched and kicked pro-democracy protestors in hong kong last night , shedding blood as they tore down demonstrators ' tents and attempted to forced them out , tania writes : student leaders called off talks with the government - offered the previous night - accusing officials of allowing violence to be used against them .
it dashed the hopes of a resolution to a mass movement that saw tens of thousands take to the streets of the city at its height .
veteran democracy activist martin lee and occupy central leader benny tai blamed triads for the violence in mong kok , a densely populated area also popular with shoppers .
the area is known for its gang presence .
lee told the south china morning post : it was very ugly in mong kok , clearly the anti-occupy people deliberately caused a scene and created trouble , giving police an excuse .
he alleged : because of the presence of the international press , the police wo n't use tear gas again to throw the people away .
so they use these triad society members to create a scene and threaten the people .
we are peace-loving and we are getting injured .
a face-off between pro-democracy protestors and a vocal mob of local residents occupy central movement protest , hong kong , china .

/rex throngs of pro-democracy protestors gather in mongkok , as thin blue police lines attempt to keep student activists and their single remaining tent separated from a vocal and violent backlash by local residents and pro-beijing supporters .
usa/rex protester gestures his frustration to a group of protesters occupying a junction on nathan road in mongkok , kowloon .
godden/robert godden/demotix/corbis
the guardian 's tania branigan ( @ taniabranigan ) sends this colorful snap from admiralty .
people are still adding messages of support to this wall at admiralty , she writes , but it 's getting hard to find space .
a wall of colorful support for the protests in admiralty .
branigan
there have been multiple reports of pepper spray use in mongkok : bastien åå¿ .
wai-chung ( @ bwaic ) mk : just helped give first aid to this guy who got pepper sprayed .
was he triad or a thug ?
i do n't know .
worried .
there have been reports in the past hour of additional police officers moving into the admiralty area , and inmedia ( @ inmediahk ) has captured an image said to be of police beating protesters .

maya wang çæ¾è² ( @ wang maya ) occupy protestors beaten by police w batons outside citic tower in admiralty just now , inmedia reports a new york times correspondent reports anger at police in mongkok .
austin ramzy ( @ austinramzy ) a shift in mong kok crowd since i was last here 3 hours ago .
from anti-protester to pro , and angry at the police for not doing more .

here 's a graphic by the economist comparing the hong kong protest to other large protests around the world by number of participants : andrew katz ( @ katz ) hong kong 's protests compared to other displays of people power :
the tent still stands .
edward wong ( @ comradewong ) mong kok tent stands into early saturday .
earlier , it felt like thugs would overrun it .
and in the morning ?

the wall street journal 's isabella steger is in kowloon , where she describes a two-block long area of argyle street , a main thoroughfare , occupied by protesters : isabella steger ( @ stegersaurus ) ok occupied area now from nathan/argyle to shanghai/argyle .
ppl screaming at police for colluding w triads .
there is a lot of talk , some by police sources , of organized crime playing a role in the new violence at protest sites friday : carrie gracie ( @ bbccarrie ) just back from ruckus in mongkok .
police source says : clearly triads involved . '
a new york times china correspondent flags an editorial in the state-line people 's daily praising the hong kong police for upholding the rule of law .
chris buckley å¨ç¾äº® ( @ chubailiang ) people 's daily commentary praises hk police for `` always abiding by the principle and bottom-line of rule of law . ''
the latest from mongkok shows many police on the scene .
the protesters have not been dislodged .

documents.title: summary
text: as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : scuffling and some violence broke out at at least three protest sites in hong kong friday as opponents of the occupy central movement confronted protesters .
the most tense scene was in mongkok , kowloon , where a large crowd gathered to oppose the occupy protesters .
there were multiple injuries in the scuffles that followed and reports of at least one violent sexual assault and attacks on journalists .
police were present in mongkok , causeway bay and elsewhere , and succeeded in separating the two sides in some cases but failed in others .
there is not enough police , one officer in mongkok said .
protest organizers said the police had failed to protect the protesters from violence .
the student 's federation said it would not hold talks with the government without such protection .
hong kong chief executive cy leung had proposed talks with protesters in a statement just before midnight thursday .
the hong kong government issued what it called another stern warning to protesters .
the warning used words such as illegal , inhumane , radical and anarchy .
the government warning said protesters should leave the area of the chief executive offices and army barracks downtown .
if you 're at the hong kong protests , we invite you to submit videos and text using the guardianwitness tool .

here 's a photo taken by user joseph koszary in admiralty about an hour ago : lightning streaks across the sky over the admiralty protest site 03.10.14 sent via guardian witness by joseph koszary 3 october 2014 , 10:25
more video footage , via reuters , of scuffling at a protest site friday in hong kong , this time in admiralty .
scuffles break out between pro-government and occupy groups in hong kong 's admiralty district on friday .
occupy protesters accuse the pro-chinese government supporters of removing barricades and deliberately trying to cause trouble in the area .
one witness claims the group had been paid by authorities to disrupt the largely peaceful pro-democracy demonstrations the footage above is from earlier this evening .
the live feed at top is also a view on protests in admiralty .
there is a lot of crowd movement , chanting and clapping at the moment .
the crowd has surrounded someone .
it appears to be him : matthew sheehan ( @ mattsheehan88 ) at admiralty students surround suspected infiltrator , hands raised and cameras clicking

documents.title: video : confrontation in causeway bay
text: the guardian 's phoebe greenwood ( @ pagreenwood ) visited the protest scene in causeway bay , east of admiralty ( see map ) , earlier friday to find a tense and at times physical standoff between pro-democracy protesters and people who are against the occupy movement .
phoebe speaks with both sides in the video below .
they 're selfish , one man opposed to occupy tells her .
i ca n't see any problem in hong kong except for those troublemakers .
he dismisses the need for more democracy in hong kong .
i do n't really mind , as long as hong kong is steady , ok ?
he says .
i make money we are very very lucky .
hong kong 's pro-democracy umbrella movement comes under attack from pro-government counter-protesters on friday .
at the island 's causeway bay protest site , demonstrators defend their barricades .

protesters are calling for the chinese government in beijing to scrap its plans to screen candidates for the role of hong kong 's most senior official in 2017 phoebe takes the accusation of selfishness back to the protesters ' side .
if he like to interpret what we are doing this way , so be it , one tells her .

many onlookers remain as tensions churn in mongkok ( and the onlookers are not necessarily sympathetic to the protestors , tania writes ) : tania branigan ( @ taniabranigan ) 10.30pm at mong kok - still a huge crowd of onlookers [ correction : this post has been modified to remove the suggestion that the onlookers in mongkok were aligned with the pro-democracy camp . ]
ed flanagan ( @ edmundflanagan ) the pro-students section though is much larger , so police have isolated the pro-china contingent to one corner
tania branigan asks a pro-democracy demonstrator in mongkok whether he is frightened .
yes , i am frightened , but i think we have to stand up to fight for our place , for our city .
( thanks to @ twitterid )
the guardian 's tania branigan ( @ taniabranigan ) has been in mongkok throughout the evening it 's currently 10.30pm local time .
police are asking the pro-democracy crowd to leave , she reports : tania branigan ( @ taniabranigan ) police again urging students to leave .
cheers from crowd .
joanna chiu of the german press agency reports that the hong kong federation of students has decided to shelve talks with the government about electoral reform .
the students say police tolerated violence against occupy protesters .
the talks were proposed late thursday by chief executive cy leung , who appointed chief secretary carrie lam to lead them .
joanna chiu ( @ joannachiu ) students ' statement saying talks with govt on electoral reform `` shelved '' , dashing hopes for resolution # occupyhk # hk

the police force in the streets in mongkok is too small and overwhelmed , afp reports : judy ngao ( @ judy ngao ) asked obviously overwhelmed policeman how many of them in # mongkok : `` i also want to know .
there is not enough police ''

police have detained some members of the pro-beijing crowd in mongkok and are taking them away by bus ( via nbc ) : ed flanagan ( @ edmundflanagan ) first bus load of detained anti-protesters loaded up to much applause and cheers of students in mongkok
here 's an updated map showing the key locations of the latest developments .
cy 's offices are in the admiralty area .

documents.title: summary
text: here 's a summary of the latest developments : violent scuffles have broken out in one of hong kong 's most famous and congested shopping districts , as supporters of chinese rule stormed tents and ripped down banners belonging to pro-democracy protesters .
police formed a human chain in mongkok to separate the two groups amid the wail of sirens .
leaders of the protests urged their supporter to leave the mongkok area for their own safety .
but hundreds of pro-occupy supporters ignored the plea and descended on the area to outnumber the pro-beijing group .
the hong kong government issued a stern warning urging protesters to immediately leave the admiralty area outside chief executive cy leung 's offices .
it said those who continue to stay will be dealt with resolutely .
numbers involved in the occupy protests have dwindled after heavy rain and as the city returned to work after a two-day holiday .
the protesters have been on the streets since last friday .
hong kong 's chief executive has refused to quit but offered talks to pro-democracy protest leaders minutes before their deadline for him to resign .
leung announced he had asked chief secretary carrie lam to speak to student representatives , as they had requested .
student groups said threatened to call off the talks unless more was done to protect pro-democracy protesters from attack .
the scene in mongkok has been very nasty all afternoon , tania branigan reports from the area as riot police arrived .
only a couple of hundred pro-beijing protesters remain .
they are being protected by a ring of police from a growing number of pro-democracy supporters , she said .
some of the pro-occupy protesters have thrown objects at the pro-beijing group even as they were being led away , she said .
police reinforcements , including some with riot gear , have been arriving .
it is certainly a very tense situation , tania said .
it is impossible to know whether the pro-beijing group were hired thugs as many have speculated .
local residents have insisted that there is a lot of genuine anger at the disruption caused by the occupy central movement .
occupy supporters are angry that the police failed to protect them from the pro-beijing group .
initially anti-occupy protesters outnumbered the pro-democracy group , but now it is the anti-occupy group who are outnumbered , tania reported .
the pro-occupy crowds have it seems ignored a plea by the protests lead to leave the area .
more people came down because they were worried [ by the clashes ] .
i just met a 58-year-old who believed that the [ pro-democracy ] protesters should go home .
he said they are causing an inconvenience but people are clearly being sent in to attack them and i do n't believe that 's right so therefore i 've come down to try and defend them .
a pro-democracy protester argues with an anti-occupy central protester while being kicked by another anti-occupy central protester at hong kong 's mongkok district , yip/reuters
here 's a map showing how far mongkok is from the from the main focus of this week 's protests .

documents.title: hong kong authorities issue 'stern warning '
text: the hong kong government has issued what it called another stern warning to protesters urging to immediately leave the area outside chief executive cy leung 's offices .
it said : the behaviour of these protesters is illegal , extremely unreasonable and inhumane , and is even worse than that of radical social activists and almost complete anarchy .

their beliefs have deviated from the aspirations of the occupy central movement.as such , the government spokesman raised the following six demands to protesters surrounding the cgo and the ceo : ( 1 ) protesters should stop acts of obstructing police officers and government officers as well as supplies from getting in and out of the cgo and the ceo ; ( 2 ) those at the scene include university students and secondary students wearing school uniform .

for the sake of student protesters , parents and teachers should advise them to leave as soon as possible ; ( 3 ) other protesters at the scene should leave immediately ; ( 4 ) media representatives should pay attention to their personal security ; ( 5 ) parents and teachers should stop young people from taking part in the protest ; and ( 6 ) organisers of occupy central and other supportive organisations involved should fulfil their moral obligation to inform the protesters to dismiss as early as possible .
the government and the police will classify protesters at the above-mentioned important government premises and people gathering in other areas into different groups .
people assembling peacefully will be accorded the greatest possible tolerance .
however , those continuously causing obstruction to the normal operation of the cgo will absolutely not be tolerated for long .
nonsensical acts of obstructing the police and other public officers carrying out their duties to serve the community will not be tolerated .
people gathering in the vicinity of the cgo and the ceo will be dealt with resolutely in accordance with the law .
on thursday leung refused to resign , as protesters have been demanding , but offered talks with protesters led by chief secretary carrie lam .
reuters estimates that around 1,000 beijing supporters clashed with about 100 protesters in the mong kok area .
police formed a human chain to separate the two groups amid the wail of sirens .
some demonstrators held umbrellas for police in the rain while beijing supporters shouted at police for failing to clear the demonstrators .
we are all fed up and our lives are affected , said teacher victor ma , 42 .
you do n't hold hong kong citizens hostage because it 's not going to work .
that 's why the crowd is very angry here .
police in mong kok have been escorting away protesters from both sides .
tom grundy ( @ tomgrundy ) police escort an # occupycentral protester who chooses to leave .
crowds jeer .
amie tsang ( @ amietsang ) applause as this man taken away after yelling at the protesters # occupyhongkong
tania branigan in hong kong has just sent through this video of scuffles in the mong kok area .
( editing thanks to @ twitterid )

protest leader joshua wong , joined benny tai , in urging protesters to leave mong kok and return to the admiralty area occupy central åå¹³ä½ä¸­ ( @ oclphk ) benny tai & joshua wong urge supporters to leave mong kok & causeway bay , continue peaceful struggle in admiralty tai insisted that the protesters should continue to be peaceful despite provocation .
kris cheng ( @ krislc ) tai `` i am angry .
i feel hate .
but i have to stop it .
we need love '' # umbrellarevolution
there are more reports and photographs of the scene turning ugly in mong kok .

reuters pictures ( @ reuters a pro-democracy protester bleeds in the month after being beaten by anti-occupy central protesters in hong kong alex ogle ( @ alex ogle ) group of men in masks beat up a man who tried stop them removing fences from democracy protest in hong kong @ twitterid afp photo department ( @ afpphoto ) police try to get a man to let go of fence guarded by pro-democracy demonstrators in hong kong # afp @ twitterid lopez
protesters leaders , including benny tai , are urging supporters to leave the mong kok area for their own safety .
pro-democracy campaigners are being urged to return to the admiralty area to consolidate .
occupy central åå¹³ä½ä¸­ ( @ oclphk ) # occupyhk supporters , return to admiralty , consolidate our strength !
å­¸è¯ hkfs ( @ hkfs1958 ) we urge all supporters in mong kok to return to admiralty .
remain peaceful and calm despite provocation .
# occupyhk meanwhile , more police are reported to have been deployed to mong kok where the clashes broke out .
austin ramzy ( @ austinramzy ) police reinforcements just arrived in mongkok tom grundy ( @ tomgrundy ) jeers as police remove an anti # occupycentral protester
welcome to live coverage of the protests in hong kong after pro-beijing groups clashed with pro-democracy protesters in chaotic scenes .

the authorities have warned protesters that police will take appropriate action including escorting protesters away , after around 200 demonstrators faced off against a much larger group of anti-protesters in the mong kok district .

afp said it was not immediately clear whether the anti-protester groups were disgruntled local business people tired of the disruption , or - as some protesters alleged - hired hands brought in to stir up trouble .
the agency added : police tried to hold back angry demonstrators who surrounded the pro-democracy protesters at a junction they had been occupying for five days .
some students backed away toward an underground rail station , while others were driven back by cheering groups .
one small group chanted i want genuine democracy , while a crowd yelled at them to go home !
as police struggled to contain the confrontation .
i do n't support occupy central .
we have to work and make money .
occupy is just a game , said a construction worker who gave his name as mr lee .
give us mong kok back , we hong kongers need to eat !
yelled another man removing the barricades there .
individuals from both sides pushed and shoved each other as water bottles were thrown and one anti-occupy protester chanted : beat them to death , good job police !
ap said police were struggling to keep order .
police formed cordons and escorted some of the protesters away as hundreds chanted , go home !
the democracy activists linked arms and held hands as they tried to stand their ground against the huge crowd .
at one point , police brought in a stretcher to take away a young man , although it was unclear why .
the police themselves were linking arms in an attempt to keep those agitating to get the area cleared of protesters from pushing into their ranks .
